content: How can I rephrase this sentence using the same components in present tense? [formula] "subject + present perfect continuous tense + object + preposition + duration of time" [formula]

To rephrase a sentence using the structure you provided in the present tense, you would use the present continuous tense instead of the present perfect continuous tense. Here's how you can structure it:

[Formula] "subject + present continuous tense + object + preposition + duration of time" [Formula]

Example:
Original (Present Perfect Continuous): "She has been studying mathematics for three hours."
Rephrased (Present Continuous): "She is studying mathematics for three hours."

Note that using the present continuous with a specific duration can sometimes imply a planned or ongoing activity rather than an activity that has continued up to the present moment.
